tasks.title: Scaffold Next.js project and create GitHub repo
tasks.description:
Project: ~/projects/website
Framework: Next.js 15 (App Router), TypeScript, Tailwind CSS 4

1. Create the project:
   cd ~/projects
   npx create-next-app@latest website --typescript --tailwind --eslint --app --src-dir --use-npm
   cd website

2. Verify the build works:
   npm run build
   (Must pass with zero errors)

3. Create GitHub repo and push:
   gh repo create website --public --source=. --push

4. Verify GitHub repo:
   gh repo view

Test: npm run build must pass with no errors.
tasks.verification: npm run build passes with zero errors; gh repo view shows the repo

tasks.title: Git commit the website
tasks.description:
Project: ~/projects/website

1. Verify build passes first:
   cd ~/projects/website
   npm run build

2. Stage all changed files:
   git add src/components/theme-provider.tsx src/components/theme-toggle.tsx src/app/page.tsx src/app/layout.tsx package.json package-lock.json

3. Also stage any other changed files (check with git status first):
   git status
   (Add any other relevant files that were modified)

4. Commit:
   git commit -m "feat: add landing page with hero, features, footer, and dark mode"

5. Push:
   git push origin main

6. Verify:
   git status (should be clean)
   git log --oneline -1 (should show the commit)

Test: git status must show clean working directory after push.
tasks.verification: git log --oneline -1 shows the commit; git status is clean; GitHub repo is up to date

tasks.title: Deploy to Vercel
tasks.description:
Project: ~/projects/website

1. Deploy to Vercel production:
   cd ~/projects/website
   npx vercel --prod --yes

2. Note the production URL from the output.

3. Verify the deployment by checking the URL is accessible:
   curl -s -o /dev/null -w "%{http_code}" <PRODUCTION_URL>
   (Should return 200)

Test: Production URL returns HTTP 200 and page content includes "Build Something Amazing".
tasks.verification: Visit the production URL in a browser â€” page loads with hero section visible
